intro: Chavannesia torulosa, commonly known as the Torulosa chavannesia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. It typically thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
